name: Ibis Solo

reviews.text: I was stay here for about two weeks, a business trip.. actually Solo is not as busy as Yogyakarta, but the ambience was similar.. so there were not a lot options to be considered in here (they are seems similar), but lets take a look the good and the bad..
reviews.title: Best rate for so so service

reviews.text: 1. It has fitness center that relatively big for 3* hotel, free of charge
reviews.title: Centrally located and what a surprise for an Ibis

reviews.text: 2. It has jacuzzi or "whirlpool" and sauna, free of charge
reviews.title: they double charged

reviews.text: Rooms are a bit small, but clean and nice. Breakfast buffet choice is nice, not to many choices but it's worth the price.Staffs are friendly and helpful. Swimming pool is not very large, but very clean and well-maintained. Location is quite in the center of the town, easily located.
reviews.title: Clean budget hotel

reviews.text: The receptionist serve other before he finish serve me ( name is EGA)
reviews.title: My Awful Trip

reviews.text: The receptionist give me the smoking room which I always avoid every time I stay with them. And when I complain, he told me that I was not tell them at the first time and there was no more room left.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: I can not sleep well because the room has smelly with the smoke even it had been sprayed.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel and good value for money

reviews.text: Staff is friendly and helpful. Swimming pool and Gym is a treat. Food is average. Although room is small, but I got twin bed room with a full view of mountain that it was admirable to saw each afternoon.
reviews.title: Definetely value for money and near a superb location

reviews.text: this hotel located in the middle of solo city, you can just walk to the famous Slamet Riyadi Street. A simple room and functional. the staff is real helpfull and full of smile, cheap and affordable price
reviews.title: simple hotel in the middle of the city

reviews.text: What can we say...we wish we'd stayed longer here. We spent 3 nights and we definetely will be back! This is a very nice hotel with nice staff and very strategically located. We can go to danar hadi museum by walk. Visit the mangkunagaran palace by becak and pasar klewer is close to the hotel by becak. Lots of nice batik also available in danar hadi store in front of the museum. Breakfast in the hotel also excellent and we love the nasi liwet. Nice kids pool and facilities are the same with novotel.l, which is very nice. We think this is the best hotel we have been to so far :-)
reviews.title: Best hotel we've ever been to!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travelled with my wife,and as soon as we entered the room, we feel the warmnes of the room. Everything is perfect in this hotel. The room and bathroom is clean, only towel need a new one. Location is near to bussiness, and tourist area. Near to cafe and local food market. Certainly, I will stay in this hotel if I visit solo again.
reviews.title: Excellent budget hotel, cleanliness, service, location. Bigger room is better.

reviews.text: the hotel is quite new, so im pretty sure to convince myself to have my room clean and smells good. i like the new concept of this hotel chain and its close to everywhere in solo within walking distace. the food was okay and the staff are excellent.
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ibis hotel in Jan 2012 and again Jan 2013. After a somewhat more primitive stay in Bali we are always happy to be in air-conditioned comforts. The hotel has declined a little since our first stay but you still get great service. The breakfast has lots of variety. The swimming pool is very nice. The stay is not a cultural one--just modern and comfortable. The hotel is centrally located and easy to get to anywhere in the city from Ibis. Will stay here again on our next visit.
reviews.title: Modern comforts
Overall Ok
reviews.text: Overall it's ok, but still too longer for point addition. I like about Ibis Promotion that is Promotion Ibis Family. we get dining voucher every day and we can spend this voucher for all desert menu. Room it's ok.

I stay at Ibis Solo for 5-days during Ied Fitri with my family. Its located close to Novotel Hotel (I stay for 2-nights). Breakfast at 6am with many choices of food. Taxi is available, but you must be carefull with Gelora Taxi. I experienced with this taxi, the driver is scammer and rid off me, eventhough I stay at Solo. The hotel room is clean. Check in is fast and easy. Nearby the hotel, you can go to gramedia book store. At the night, you can walk nearby the hotel to find many kinds of food. I think it is safe area at night, but if you not willing to walk, you can go by becak, it cost aroud $2. (Rp 20.000). I recommend this hotel, for the cheap price and convenience...
reviews.title: Cheap Hotel, Good Service and Good Location

reviews.text: Nice hotel and friendly services even though the room quite small, located in city center so its near to go everywhere and easy to find food near the hotel. With complete facility while staying in Solo.
reviews.title: Modern and minimalist hotel

description: Ibis Solo is located in the heart of Solo's city, on the prominent Gajah Mada Street, adjacent to Novotel Solo. The hotel is only minutes away from business district, recreation centre and shopping malls; moreover the distance from Adi Sumarmo International Airport is only 15 minutes away and 5 minutes from Balapan Train Station.
